name: uneasily
content:
uneasily adverb
(WORRIED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you are slightly worried or uncomfortable about a particular situation: He looked around uneasily.
More examplesFewer examplesThey looked about uneasily as they placed the call. He smiles uneasily when talking about what he'll do if his plans to boost profits fail. Carlos nods in agreement, but shifts uneasily. Millions of Americans are now watching uneasily as trends that are beyond their control threaten to dissipate their way of life.

uneasily adverb
(AWKWARDLY)
in a way that does not fit well or seems awkward or unlikely: The two religions have coexisted uneasily for some time. His defense of USintentions sits uneasily with other things he says.
More examplesFewer examplesPolitics mingles uneasily with faith. The play is a family drama that uneasily straddles age groups and genres. This incident fits uneasily into people's stereotypes of modern Los Angeles.
